content: In the summer of 2018, I was denied a mortgage loan due to a charge off from Chase Bank credit card. I both mailed an account validation letter and disputed this debt with the credit bureaus, but the issue was not resolved.
There are many mistakes appearing in my credit report without my understanding. For example, an old utility bill from 2015 is listed as unpaid, but I have proof of payment.

There is an account reporting on my credit report from Wells Fargo which is saying the balance is coming from Bank of America from January 2012. I never signed a joint lease with anyone, and this account does not belong to me.

The reason for my writing is to inform you that this company is being unreasonable and not adhering to the law. I am a victim of identity theft. My personal information was compromised and fraudulent accounts were opened in my name.

Equifax and Transunion are reporting incorrectly that I am 120 days past due on a loan with Capital One - partial account number 1234. This account reflects a $0.00 balance and a $0.00 past due, but the late payment remains on my report.

Equifax and Transunion are reporting incorrectly that I am 120 days past due on loans with Discover - partial account numbers 5678; 9101; 1121; 3141. These accounts reflect a $0.00 balance, but the late payments are still listed.

There are several accounts falsely reported to my credit report. I complained to the FTC, and directly to the credit bureaus. I submitted copies of my driver's license, Social Security Card, and current bills to prove my identity, but the errors remain.

On March 15, 2021, I sent a request to the three credit bureaus, asking them to investigate three errors on my credit report. TransUnion had no problem completing this task, as I got my response back from them within 30 days.

On March 15, 2021, I sent a request to the three credit bureaus, asking them to investigate three errors on my credit report. Experian had no problem completing this task, as I got my response back from them within 30 days.
I never received anything stating that I owed this company money. My first time seeing this is when I pulled my credit report. Never got a notice in the mail or any other communication.
